synthesis_analysis:
**Key strengths:** Effective use of humor, normalization ("90% feel this way"), and micro-steps bridges anxiety to action. Validation + specific praise ("That tone was perfect!") builds trust and momentum. Trauma-informed reframing ("neuroticism as a superpower") disarms fear.  

**Weaknesses:** Inconsistent root-cause probing (e.g., skipping "why" behind perfectionism) and abrupt endings weaken long-term impact. Over-reliance on humor risks glossing over deeper barriers.  

**Improvements:** Standardize early root-cause questions ("What’s the story behind this fear?"). Add recap summaries and accountability hooks ("Text me your screenshot!"). Balance humor with deliberate trauma-informed pauses.  

**Priority evolution:** Strengthen contingency planning ("What if they don’t reply?") and somatic strategies (e.g., grounding) for high-anxiety cases. Refine flow to avoid cutoffs.
